page.title: 06EDUCATION IN BETHERSDEN
page.content: THERE IS ONE SCHOOL IN BETHERSDEN CATERING FOR CHILDREN FROM AGES 5-11. THIS IS A STATE SCHOOL WITH 5 TEACHERS AND 110 PUPILS.THE BUILDING IS IN 2 PARTS ONE PRE-1900 AND THE OTHER ERECTED IN 1968. THESE BUILDINGS CONTAIN 5 CLASSROOMS AND A HALL. OUTSIDE THERE IS A LARGE PLAYING FIELD PLAYGROUNDS,SMALL SWIMMING POOL AND HEADTEACHER'S HOUSE.IN ADDITION TO THE BASIC SUBJECTS READING,ENGLISH AND MATHEMATICS,CHILDREN ARE TAUGHT A WIDE RANGE OF SUBJECTS;MUSIC,SCIENCE,GAMES CRAFTS,SOCIAL STUDIES ETC.MOST PUPILS WALK TO SCHOOL BUT SOME,LIVING ON THE VILLAGE OUTSKIRTS,JOURNEY BY CAR,BUS, OR BICYCLE.AT 11 PUPILS TRANSFER TO SECONDARY SCHOOL IN TENTERDEN.MOST VILLAGE CHILDREN ATTEND THE SCHOOL BUT SOME PAY TO BE EDUCATED AT PRIVATE SCHOOLS ELSEWHERE.THERE IS A NURSERY AND PLAYSCHOOL IN THE VILLAGE HALL.
